messages: [{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-05-22 15:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-05-22 17:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 30381, 'date': '2019-05-23 23:10:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23509, 'date': '2019-05-26 09:32:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-05-27 05:32:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-22 15:01:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix mistral metal deploy

In AIO CI deploy, we are relying on aio_metal.yml.example to
determine what to set in the runtime env.d (it is copied there,
verbatim).

Sadly we added in env.d the support for mistral, without editing
this file. So, by default, the integrated will use lxc, as the
group for mistral will not have is_metal: true. Therefore
the lxc_hosts group will also be populated, and the deployment
is then using lxc for just this container. It is not respecting
the requirement for running 'on metal'.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: Icf29be45ceba24b31ff471157b630e23661709a5
(cherry picked from commit 847b0a111066a7d03f83db84d7f5f670798e4cca)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix mistral metal deploy

In AIO CI deploy, we are relying on aio_metal.yml.example to
determine what to set in the runtime env.d (it is copied there,
verbatim).

Sadly we added in env.d the support for mistral, without editing
this file. So, by default, the integrated will use lxc, as the
group for mistral will not have is_metal: true. Therefore
the lxc_hosts group will also be populated, and the deployment
is then using lxc for just this container. It is not respecting
the requirement for running 'on metal'.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: Icf29be45ceba24b31ff471157b630e23661709a5
(cherry picked from commit 847b0a111066a7d03f83db84d7f5f670798e4cca)

commit_message:
Switch ansible-role-jobs docs job

Use openstack-tox-docs instead of obsolete build-openstack-sphinx jobs.

This template is used by x/monitorstack,
x/ansible-role-cloud-launcher, windmill/ansible-role-ansible,
windmill/windmill, windmill/windmill-backup.

On ansible-role-cloud-launcher this
change will avoid running two docs jobs (tox-docs as part of
docs-on-readthedocs and build-sphinx as part of ansible-role-jobs).

All repos have tox.ini with a docs job. so should work with this change.

Change-Id: I27917040750e52f123e81ab9aea1454dea0729c8

commit_message:
Use openstack-tox-docs for deploy-guide job

Rebase job on openstack-tox-docs so that teams
can control environment, similar to what we did for openstack-tox-docs.

The repos using the deploy-guide jobs have already a tox.ini environment
set up, so no changes needed for these repos.

Change-Id: I76759ba076c5ecccea9432651ebb9b4f3fd8856a

commit_message:
Fix confusing statement in tempest-dsvm-full-hdfs

Appears to be a copy/paste error from copying the
tempest-dsvm-full-sheepdog playbook - but it's a correct instantiation
of a template used for multiple jobs.

Drop the unnecessary block that was
unreachable anyway.

Change-Id: I83ba4541f36897eafc8782c4741febf257064ef3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Handle properly 404 responses from Neutron

In cleanUp methods there is no need to fail test if Neutron returns
404 for DELETE request.
This commit adds test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc helper function
to be used in cleanup of Neutron resources.

Change-Id: I2c394d3219e16f653343d7043d36f55048f211dd
Closes-Bug: #1824018

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-17 22:09:50.000000000', 'message': "Allow searching for hypervisors and getting back details

The 2.53 microversion allows listing hypervisors with
details and filtering on a hypervisor_hostname substring
pattern match.

This makes the python API binding HypervisorManager.search
method allow that as well by adding a new 'detailed' boolean
kwarg which defaults to False for backward compatibility for
the /search and /servers routes before 2.53, but allows
searching and getting detailed results back as well.

Change-Id: I81fa4520af3cc7f1298c262f4fdc4e15fbc6d7ba
"}, {'created': '2019-05-18 18:47:53.000000000', 'message': "Allow searching for hypervisors and getting back details

The 2.53 microversion allows listing hypervisors with
details and filtering on a hypervisor_hostname substring
pattern match.

This makes the python API binding HypervisorManager.search
method allow that as well by adding a new 'detailed' boolean
kwarg which defaults to False for backward compatibility for
the /search and /servers routes before 2.53, but allows
searching and getting detailed results back as well.

Change-Id: I81fa4520af3cc7f1298c262f4fdc4e15fbc6d7ba
"}]
commit_message:
Allow searching for hypervisors and getting back details

The 2.53 microversion allows listing hypervisors with
details and filtering on a hypervisor_hostname substring
pattern match.

This makes the python API binding HypervisorManager.search
method allow that as well by adding a new 'detailed' boolean
kwarg which defaults to False for backward compatibility for
the /search and /servers routes before 2.53, but allows
searching and getting detailed results back as well.

Change-Id: I81fa4520af3cc7f1298c262f4fdc4e15fbc6d7ba

commit_message:
Record action finish

In before, there is no way to detect if an action is finished or not.
This commit add tracking for each action and record on DB once
an action is finish.

Change-Id: I9945087cf8d1484c09e60d11b1ba0c84c1799f00

commit_message:
Remove get_cpu_used from container driver

This method is heavy since it inspects each container in Docker.
The computed value is basically not used. This commit removes it.

Change-Id: I21a4ab8934196afd43ae15f5aa76464dab2b5bd2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 20:03:52.000000000', 'message': 'Remove 2.56 version compatibility check

With change Id34938c7bb8a5ca934d997e52cac3b365414c006
we require nova API version 2.56 or greater so we can
remove the compatibliity check in the
watcher_non_live_migrate_instance method.

The _check_nova_api_version method is left in place
for future compability checks.

Change-Id: I69040fbc13b03d90b9687c0d11104d4a5bae51d3
'}]
commit_message:
Remove 2.56 version compatibility check

With change Id34938c7bb8a5ca934d997e52cac3b365414c006
we require nova API version 2.56 or greater so we can
remove the compatibliity check in the
watcher_non_live_migrate_instance method.

The _check_nova_api_version method is left in place
for future compability checks.

commit_message:
Remove python3.5 jobs for Train

The TC has decided that python 3.5 tests are not required for Train
forward[1]. This patch removes the python 3.5 jobs from
python-octaviaclient.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/ \
    005097.html

Change-Id: Id9c67cb00842dd7ce0be9e5aabfc38bfa197518c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-26 23:58:17.000000000', 'message': "Remove the network policy creation in k8s orchestrator

Previously, the network policy(based on ipBlock) is created during k8s
orchestrator initialization to restrict the function pod access from
outside.

However, the network policy is actually designed to use inside the k8s
cluster, it doesn't make sense to define the network policy in order to
restrict the inbound traffic from outside. A typical example is when
Calico is used as network plugin in the k8s cluster, the source IP
address from the pod's perspective is coming from the worker node rather
than the original IP address of outside.

We need to remove the network policy creation for now and leave that
part of security concerns to the future design.

The config option `CONF.kubernetes.trusted_cidrs` is deprecated for
removal.

Change-Id: I91905ba36b36f152a987ce2b742de33e423ed2db
Story: #2005777
Task: #33500
Story: #2005710
Task: #31036

commit_message:
Remove the network policy creation in k8s orchestrator

Previously, the network policy(based on ipBlock) is created during k8s
orchestrator initialization to restrict the function pod access from
outside.

However, the network policy is actually designed to use inside the k8s
cluster, it doesn't make sense to define the network policy in order to
restrict the inbound traffic from outside. A typical example is when
Calico is used as network plugin in the k8s cluster, the source IP
address from the pod's perspective is coming from the worker node rather
than the original IP address of outside.

We need to remove the network policy creation for now and leave that
part of security concerns to the future design.

The config option `CONF.kubernetes.trusted_cidrs` is deprecated for
removal.

Change-Id: I91905ba36b36f152a987ce2b742de33e423ed2db
Story: #2005777
Task: #33500
Story: #2005710
Task: #31036

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-01-21 10:22:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

OK - something else that occurs to me is that there are group_vars for beats_all defined in the integration inventory which will not be in scope for any plays run with with conventional openstack-ansible plays or ad-hoc commands. It feels like we should be careful having the same group names defined in two different inventories as there is bound to be a collision/precedence of vars snafu at some point.

Forcing the integration inventory to be bought into scope to define the beats_all group would ensure that the beats_all group_vars were also in scope as expected.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-01-22 04:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > OK - something else that occurs to me is that there are group_vars

 > be in scope for any plays run with with conventional
 > openstack-ansible plays or ad-hoc commands. It feels like we should
 > be careful having the same group names defined in two different
 > inventories as there is bound to be a collision/precedence of vars
 > snafu at some point.
 > 
 > Forcing the integration inventory to be bought into scope to define
 > the beats_all group would ensure that the beats_all group_vars were
 > also in scope as expected.

How should we proceed? Maybe we make a PR to create an empty "beats_all" group in the integrated inventory or just doc how to create it here?'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-01-22 14:43:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 22:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'modify playbook inventory to make groups more specific

Some of the playbooks in the ops repo were targetting global groups
like "all" which can and will cause unexpected results, especially
when running with a secondary inventory source. This change refactors
some of our group memberships to ensure they're specificly set.

> While this is a great step forward to making the ops tooling more
  robust, it will require some deployers to update their environment
  files in integrated OSA deployments to support the new groups.

Change-Id: I51b0b7dbab7851db49386366d327f8fbfc3127a6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

some of our group memberships to ensure they're specificly set.

> While this is a great step forward to making the ops tooling more
  robust, it will require some deployers to update their environment
  files in integrated OSA deployments to support the new groups.

Change-Id: I51b0b7dbab7851db49386366d327f8fbfc3127a6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
'}]
commit_message:
modify playbook inventory to make groups more specific

Some of the playbooks in the ops repo were targetting global groups
like "all" which can and will cause unexpected results, especially
when running with a secondary inventory source. This change refactors
some of our group memberships to ensure they're specificly set.

> While this is a great step forward to making the ops tooling more
  robust, it will require some deployers to update their environment
  files in integrated OSA deployments to support the new groups.

Change-Id: I51b0b7dbab7851db49386366d327f8fbfc3127a6
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Removed conditional in test setup

If the setup script is run more than once on a given environment it will
fail because of missing facts. The removal of this conditional will
ensure that the facts are always set accordingly allowing the task file
to execute successfully.

Change-Id: I06ca053f72c151b223fac7f1fe5e759ea197647c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Properly configure cinder-volume containers

The cinder-volume containers were not being properly configured when LVM
was not in use. This change adds a second task to the cinder common
playbook to have all cinder-volume containers run through the normal
configuration process.

Change-Id: If24dabdb953b28bbdd1eaf03e48c8b0f0bd37b0e
Closes-Bug: #1756005
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add option to define the qemu security driver

It is recommended to set the qemu security driver by default. This
change ensures that nova compute will define the security driver based
on a given OS deployment unless specifically defined by the deployer in
a user variable file.

Change-Id: I567081403e2aabe9e0747f40e5bf0976d0f949ff
Closes-Bug: #1732481
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix multi-OS support

This change updates the role to allow it to function when deploying against
multiple operating systems.

* The ssh enable tasks does not need to use delegation. When it uses delegation
  on multiple operating systems the vars_files and variables will not be correct
* Directory creations for ssl / pki will now ignore_errors. We assume we can
  create a symlink however the path, on a new kick, may already be a directoy.

Change-Id: I752248bff3cfade1d3e48489da6b76cd9f20b883
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Test using integrated build

In order to do a more complete verification of any patches,
we add a full uncontainerised OpenStack deployment to the
functional testing using the integrated repo. This replaces
the previous role functional test mechanism.

Any additional role tests are left as-is. They will require
some extra implementation in the integrated build before they
can be transferred.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/647840
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/645653
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/648551
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/648593
Change-Id: I3d24c533338317ab906fd649ccbff6c4cd9686c4
Signed-off-by: cloudnull <kevin@cloudnull.com>

commit_message:
Convert self-signed SSL to use the openssl modules

The current process uses command tasks to generate self-signed
certificates. This removes our useage of command tasks in favor
of using the ansible modules.

Change-Id: I0c0a93a97971ea8527df2c39d286253d817fd37a

subject: Restructure playbook serialization
messages:
[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-12 03:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-07-12 03:56:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM... I guess technically our orchestration is wrong now according to the rolling upgrade guides since we aren't operating on separate components as we were pre-hyperconverged. This patch won't make the problem worse, if it is a problem at all, but we'll have to see if rolling upgrades are meaningfully impacted by the hyperconvergence at some point."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-12 06:16:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-12 08:53:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

With these changes we are effectively removing the ability to run in a non-hyper-converged fashion, which we still do support.

If we're going to do this then we should remove that capability, or at least add a release note to say that things won't work so well if you are still running that way."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:13:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> With these changes we are effectively removing the ability to run
 > in a non-hyper-converged fashion, which we still do support.
 > 
 > If we're going to do this then we should remove that capability, or
 > at least add a release note to say that things won't work so well
 > if you are still running that way.

With all of the other tasks at the bottom of these plays to restart services I no longer believe all of the extra serialization playbooks are required to ensure the service state."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:21:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

All those tasks are for upgrades only and are specifically implemented to do reverse restarts as documented in the projects when doing upgrades.

I agree that there's more we can do here, but I don't think we should simply hack something that works just to cut time. I'd rather see us identify a universal new pattern for upgrades identified in a spec which we can apply as a pattern across roles and playbooks in Stein.

As it stands now, the playbooks err on the side of caution to implement a rolling upgrade. It's slow, but works.

I'd be happy to collaborate on building a spec to figure out a better pattern for Stein. Fire up an etherpad to describe the problem, then let's work out some options and record them and discuss them at the next meeting."}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-07-12 14:25:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Bear in mind that one of our use-cases is a zero-container deployment, where each service could possibly be deployed on its own host.

I'd be happy to see that this patch does not break that use-case (or the old spread container model) before we consider going ahead and accepting changes like this.

Quite honestly, we've got enough on our plates already - I think we should focus on finishing what we've got in terms of features for this cycle instead of adding a remodeling of upgrades to the picture just two weeks before feature freeze at M3."}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-07-12 15:36:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> I'd rather see us identify a universal new pattern for upgrades
 > identified in a spec which we can apply as a pattern across roles
 > and playbooks in Stein.

Agreed... between the hyperconverged and bare metal use cases, the current method of rolling upgrades is broken by default and only works in what I can only imagine are extreme edge cases where folks have rewired environment similar to the old container setup pre-queens."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2019-05-27 00:22:55.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-12 03:45:55.000000000', 'message': "Restructure playbook serialization

Now that many of the state-full services are either running in a
hyper-converged container or a systemd sandbox some of the older group
usage is no longer 100% relevant and is simply executing the same
playbooks and tasks on the same nodes which is simply prolonging
execution times. This change restructures the playbook serialization
to optimize for speed while also ensuring we're not breaking the the
integrity of our orchestration.

Change-Id: I99db3805d1f87b4da55e3b98f9a52ebd8cff5cef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Restructure playbook serialization

Now that many of the state-full services are either running in a
hyper-converged container or a systemd sandbox some of the older group
usage is no longer 100% relevant and is simply executing the same
playbooks and tasks on the same nodes which is simply prolonging
execution times. This change restructures the playbook serialization
to optimize for speed while also ensuring we're not breaking the the
integrity of our orchestration.

Change-Id: I99db3805d1f87b4da55e3b98f9a52ebd8cff5cef
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

Remove dead code from NovaClusterDataModelCollector

The _add_virtual_layer and _add_virtual_servers methods
have not been used since Ic4659d1f18af181203439a8bf1b38805ff34c309
in Stein so this change removes them.

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install

Since neutron and networkinf-sfc are now in global-requirements,
we can remove the installation from tools/tox_install.sh.

Remove the tox_install files completely and update tox.ini for this.
Add requirements to requirements.txt instead.

Update sphinx requirements to pass requirements check.

Update tools/ostestr_compat_shim.sh following
https://review.opendev.org/657223/ to workaround
an incompatiblity between stestr and ostestr.

Change-Id: Ieed2990dc251eab579b252929d454efa17d19245

If for some reason we don't have a valid endpoint to provide the
Ironic client, we should at the very least provide the information
it needs to make an informed decision.

	nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_client_wrapper.py
From change I5f78d21c39ed2fd58d2a0f3649116e39883d5a2c which renamed the
'endpoint' key in the ironicclient get_client kwargs to 'ironic_url'.

Change-Id: I31fa1c6fb0b224fbb02f9ebf68abc6a3728e9389
Partial-Bug: #1825583
(cherry picked from commit 6eaa6db0ee01ee5a7b56bc3176914d85e697b96a)
(cherry picked from commit 222f462444b72368cd5f22d4b0ac9baf0bbe8e0c)
"}, {'created': '2019-04-30 22:52:33.000000000', 'message': 'Pass on region when we don't have a valid ironic endpoint

If for some reason we don't have a valid endpoint to provide the
Ironic client, we should at the very least provide the information
it needs to make an informed decision.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_client_wrapper.py
The conflict here is twofold:
- Each release has a different value for the latest/previous
  os_ironic_api_version kwarg. This fix doesn't change that value, so it
  needs to be "left alone" in the tests.
- The 'ironic_url' kwarg was renamed to 'endpoint' in the stein release

'}]
commit_message:
Pass on region when we don't have a valid ironic endpoint

If for some reason we don't have a valid endpoint to provide the
Ironic client, we should at the very least provide the information
it needs to make an informed decision.

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_client_wrapper.py
The conflict here is twofold:
- Each release has a different value for the latest/previous
  os_ironic_api_version kwarg. This fix doesn't change that value, so it
  needs to be "left alone" in the tests.
- The 'ironic_url' kwarg was renamed to 'endpoint' in the stein release
  [1]; it needs to be left as 'ironic_url' in rocky and prior.

[1] I1b3ce1955622c40b780c0b15ec7e09be3e8ace72

Change-Id: I31fa1c6fb0b224fbb02f9ebf68abc6a3728e9389
Partial-Bug: #1825583
(cherry picked from commit 6eaa6db0ee01ee5a7b56bc3176914d85e697b96a)
(cherry picked from commit 222f462444b72368cd5f22d4b0ac9baf0bbe8e0c)

commit_message:
Skip novnc tests in multi-cell job until bug 1830417 is fixed

NoVNCConsoleTestJSON.test_novnc is intermittently failing
in the multi-cell job when trying to get a vnc console for
an instance in cell2. It looks like requests aren't getting
routed to the novnc-cell2 service properly, so let's skip
novnc tests until the bug is fixed since we want to stabilize
this job to make it voting.

Change-Id: I74a4b392ccec66a7a80a117d1cdf83a418c7dcdc
Related-Bug: #1830417

commit_message:
Add support for ethtool options for sriov_pf ports

There are deployment cases where ethtool configurations
are required to be performed on a sriov_pf port.

Main Changes:
- Add ethtool options to sriov_pf port type.
- Unify ethtool options logic between Interface, IbInterface and
  SriovPF in ifcfg provider.
- Add missing unit-test of ethtool options for IbInterface.

Change-Id: I681d5b4e33711fcb61cd39d8d5d10770876b53ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-13 09:21:07.000000000', 'message': 'Point to OSH-images images

We now have a process for OSH-images image building,
using Zuul, so we should point the images by default to those
images, instead of pointing to stale images.

Without this, the osh-images build process is completely not
in use (and completely opaque to deployers), and updating the
osh-images process or patching its code has no impact on OSH-addons.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I23d69b56e6de4f0f76d6031b301e81a294ddcc50
'}]
commit_message:
Point to OSH-images images

We now have a process for OSH-images image building,
using Zuul, so we should point the images by default to those
images, instead of pointing to stale images.

Without this, the osh-images build process is completely not
in use (and completely opaque to deployers), and updating the
osh-images process or patching its code has no impact on OSH-addons.

This should fix it.

Change-Id: I23d69b56e6de4f0f76d6031b301e81a294ddcc50

commit_message:
Fix devstack plugin python3 support

The octavia-dashboard devstack plugin.sh script was calling
"python". This causes the plugin to fail on python3 only hosts.
This patch corrects this by using the devstack $PYTHON variable.

Change-Id: I18bc3ce532e163acc1d49daa84cd7c7495dbc777
Story: 2005761
Task: 33469

commit_message:
Fix devstack plugin python3 support

The octavia-dashboard devstack plugin.sh script was calling
"python". This causes the plugin to fail on python3 only hosts.
This patch corrects this by using the devstack $PYTHON variable.

Change-Id: I18bc3ce532e163acc1d49daa84cd7c7495dbc777
Story: 2005761
Task: 33469

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-21 19:26:50.000000000', 'message': 'Move patch_exists() to nova.test.TestCase for reuse

In the near future, more tests (specifically, some SEV tests) will
want to patch os.path.exists to return a given value, whilst avoiding
interfering with other checks for path existence inside the test
virtualenv (e.g. placement-policy.yaml).

TestGuestConfigSysinfoSerialOS already had a nice patch_exists()
context manager for selectively patching os.path.exists based on
the path parameter, so move this to nova.test.TestCase so that
it can be reused.  In order to make it generic, the path has
to be introduced as an extra parameter alongside the desired
return value.

Change-Id: Ibe7cb29620f06d31059f2a5f94ca180b8671046e
'}, {'created': '2019-05-23 12:50:44.000000000', 'message': 'Move patch_exists() to nova.test.TestCase for reuse

In the near future, more tests (specifically, some SEV tests) will
want to patch os.path.exists to return a given value, whilst avoiding
interfering with other checks for path existence inside the test
virtualenv (e.g. placement-policy.yaml).

TestGuestConfigSysinfoSerialOS already had a nice patch_exists()
context manager for selectively patching os.path.exists based on
the path parameter, so move this to nova.test.TestCase so that
it can be reused.  In order to make it generic, the path has
to be introduced as an extra parameter alongside the desired
return value.

commit_message:
Move patch_exists() to nova.test.TestCase for reuse

Several existing tests patch os.path.exists() to return a given value,
whilst avoiding interfering with other checks for path existence
inside the test virtualenv.  Currently they do it by duplicating
logic.

Furthermore, in the near future, more tests (specifically, some SEV
functional tests) will want to do the same selective patching, and
similarly will need to avoid impacting existence checks on other files
within the test virtualenv, e.g. placement-policy.yaml.

TestGuestConfigSysinfoSerialOS already had a nice patch_exists()
context manager for selectively patching os.path.exists based on the
path parameter, so move this to nova.test.TestCase so that it can be
reused to reduce duplication, and add appropriate unit test cases.

In order to make patch_exists() generic, the path has to be introduced
as an extra parameter alongside the desired return value.

Additionally make it usable as a decorator, not just a context
manager.  This is achievable natively in Python 3 with contextlib, and
in Python 2 via contextlib2.

Change-Id: Ibe7cb29620f06d31059f2a5f94ca180b8671046e

commit_message:
Add update_id for ResourceUpdate

Add a unique id for resource update, then we can calculate
the resource processing time and track it.

Related-Bug: #1825152
Related-Bug: #1824911
Related-Bug: #1821912
Related-Bug: #1813787

Change-Id: Ib4d197c6c180c32860964440882393794aabb6ef
(cherry picked from commit 9d60716cf1d61286a684f20ef8e05c77a0df5aa3)

> library? I found this thread [1] discussing > its usage and it looks like it is available > in the Openstack global requirements. [2]

> Can I simply import it here ?


Yes, we use it in manila [1]... im not opposed to it,but the wait_for_*_status in tempest and manila-tempest-plugin methods do implement a simple waiter with exponential back off without using the retrying library...

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/9aac703672230a1acabdada94f4db16b3151fc58/manila/utils.py#L450'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-03-16 13:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 32.'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-03-16 13:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(3 comments)

> > Regarding the exponential backoff, what is your opinion about
 > using the "retrying"
 > > library? I found this thread [1] discussing > its usage and it
 > looks like it is available > in the Openstack global requirements.
 > [2]
 > 
 > > Can I simply import it here ?
 > 
 > 
 > Yes, we use it in manila [1]... im not opposed to it,but the
 > wait_for_*_status in tempest and manila-tempest-plugin methods do
 > implement a simple waiter with exponential back off without using
 > the retrying library...
 > 
 > [1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/9aac703672230a1acabdada94f4db16b3151fc58/manila/utils.py#L450

The wait_for_*_status methods are using a constant timeout interval, and not increasing it expo. at each iteration. That's why I started looking at solutions - but if this does the job..'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-16 22:02:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-16 22:10:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 32:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-03-18 17:20:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 33.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-22 03:24:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 33:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-03-24 16:23:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 34.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-03-25 18:22:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 34:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-04-01 14:36:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 35.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-01 18:35:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 35:

(2 comments)

Thanks for the changes. Please see comments on another change. I think it's time to add another job and see how it fares... In .zuul.yaml, you should be able to add back this job:

        - manila-tempest-dsvm-scenario:
            voting: false"}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-04-02 19:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 36.'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-04-03 06:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36:

(2 comments)

Not quite sure how to debug the dsvm-scenario job failure.
It seems to fail on cleaning up the share, correct?

http://logs.openstack.org/15/531615/36/check/manila-tempest-dsvm-scenario/b571d99/job-output.txt.gz#_2019-04-02_21_07_24_433623'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-03 23:24:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 36:

(3 comments)

> Not quite sure how to debug the dsvm-scenario job failure.
> It seems to fail on cleaning up the share, correct?

The ultimate failure is detected while cleaning up the share, before that, the share was set to "shrinking_error". If you look at the tempest log [1], the test has reset the status and attempted to shrink the share 82 times (search for "202 POST http://104.130.138.44/share/v2/c6d0ddf152374884946dc19f4200034a/shares/be61f4bb-bcca-4468-87bc-48ea9bb9a051/action") - there's a possibility the share got negatively affected with these re-attempts.. See the driver log [2] which seems to suggest that teh driver cannot find the share.. Please see notes inline on how to sanitize this further... 

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/15/531615/36/check/manila-tempest-dsvm-scenario/b571d99/logs/tempest.txt.gz
[2] http://logs.openstack.org/15/531615/36/check/manila-tempest-dsvm-scenario/b571d99/logs/screen-m-shr.txt.gz#_Apr_02_20_44_39_773236'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-04-04 07:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 37.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-04 14:58:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

recheck

Good stuff'}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-04-04 15:07:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 37:

> recheck
 > 
 > Good stuff

Thanks! Do you see this last failure as a potential instability in the manage/unmanage test? Last thing I want is to add any instability..'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-04 15:31:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

> Thanks! Do you see this last failure as a potential instability in the manage/unmanage test? Last thing I want is to add any instability..


Famous last words, when it comes to our tempest testing strategy :) This stuff here is a great addition to the tests. The instability could be a bug in the zfs driver that we can investigate... I haven't seen it prior, so I rechecked this change. More often than not, the instability in our scenario tests comes from SSH authentication issues with nova VMs.. Something that we've been committing fixes as we see it."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-04 19:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

recheck

Passes consistently on dsvm-scenario, so that's a good thing. The ZFSOnLinux job timed out, after an hour of starting test runs.. DevStack took ~42 mins, it's a slower-than-usual node."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-04 22:08:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

recheck

Ugh. These timeouts are a major pita. We'll discuss this stuff at our PTG [1] and see if we can resolve them for good. In both timeout cases above, migration tests failed, and the test that failed took forever, and ate up the remaining time required for the other tests to run."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-04 22:12:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 37:

(5 comments)

I think we're close to getting this done with.. some changes noted inline.."}, {'account_id': 26535, 'date': '2019-04-05 08:05:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 38.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-04-06 02:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38: Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-10 23:28:01.000000000', 'message': 'Async notify neutron-server for HA states

RPC notifier method can sometimes be time-consuming,
this will cause other parallel processing resources
fail to send notifications in time. This patch changes
the notify to asynchronous.

Closes-Bug: #1824911

commit_message:
Async notify neutron-server for HA states

RPC notifier method can sometimes be time-consuming,
this will cause other parallel processing resources
fail to send notifications in time. This patch changes
the notify to asynchronous.

Closes-Bug: #1824911
Change-Id: I3f555a0c78fbc02d8214f12b62c37d140bc71da1
(cherry picked from commit 0f471a47c073eb0cf2ed68c30482e1ae71ff6927)

commit_message:
Update the min version of tox to 2.0

The verification comands used by tox need at least 2.0 version. This
patch aims to update tox version from 1.6 to 2.0 which should help with
local running of constraints targets.

Change-Id: I7140199d9fa6544d0af69216a9f467b04ed2cad4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 16:03:38.000000000', 'message': "[Functional tests] Test keepalived in namespaces

Functional tests for keepalived should spawn processes in namespaces
where dummy interfaces used in keepalived.conf file exists.
Otherwise keepalived 2.0.10 (this is version used currently in RHEL 8)
fails to start and tests are failing.

On older versions of keepalived, like 1.3.9 used in Ubuntu 18.04,
keepalived is logging warning about not existing interfaces but it's
starting fine thus tests are running properly.

So this patch adds creation of namespace for each test from
neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux.test_keepalived module,
creates dummy interfaces with names used in keepalived config file
and runs keepalive process in this namespace.

Change-Id: I54f45b8c52fc1ecce811b028f0f92e0d78d3157b
Closes-Bug: #1830232
"}, {'created': '2019-05-23 19:42:58.000000000', 'message': "[Functional tests] Test keepalived in namespaces

Functional tests for keepalived should spawn processes in namespaces
where dummy interfaces used in keepalived.conf file exists.
Otherwise keepalived 2.0.10 (this is version used currently in RHEL 8)
fails to start and tests are failing.

On older versions of keepalived, like 1.3.9 used in Ubuntu 18.04,
keepalived is logging warning about not existing interfaces but it's
starting fine thus tests are running properly.

So this patch adds creation of namespace for each test from
neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux.test_keepalived module,
creates dummy interfaces with names used in keepalived config file
and runs keepalive process in this namespace.

Change-Id: I54f45b8c52fc1ecce811b028f0f92e0d78d3157b
Closes-Bug: #1830232
"}]
commit_message:
[Functional tests] Test keepalived in namespaces

Functional tests for keepalived should spawn processes in namespaces
where dummy interfaces used in keepalived.conf file exists.
Otherwise keepalived 2.0.10 (this is version used currently in RHEL 8)
fails to start and tests are failing.

On older versions of keepalived, like 1.3.9 used in Ubuntu 18.04,
keepalived is logging warning about not existing interfaces but it's
starting fine thus tests are running properly.

So this patch adds creation of namespace for each test from
neutron.tests.functional.agent.linux.test_keepalived module,
creates dummy interfaces with names used in keepalived config file
and runs keepalive process in this namespace.

Change-Id: I54f45b8c52fc1ecce811b028f0f92e0d78d3157b
Closes-Bug: #1830232

commit_message:
Update git load balancer for OpenDev

The git0X.openstack.org backends have been replaced by
gitea0X.opendev.org.  Update the metric names to match, as well
as the title of the dashboard.  Remove the git protocol section
since we don't support that anymore.

Change-Id: I644cd07ccda296a588fd5e897db0fcf71a3edaa1

Not from API's end point. User can still send ipv6-icmp, icmp and icmp6 .

>If I get this right, by doing this you are enforcing that you can create three different SG rules with ether type IPv6, and protocol 'icmp', 'icmpv6' and 'ipv6-icmp'.

>So you are enforcing the behaviour that in bug your saying is wrong?

commit_message:
Change tests to handle different ICMP IPv6 values

ICMP in IPv6 can be defined in multiple ways by the user.
This patch increases the coverage of the test cases by testing
across different combinations of ICMP IPv6 test cases.
This inturn improves the test which would be required for testing
the neutron fix in [1].

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/427670
Change-Id: I86ae394a0d5d31f00efa934ffa7c98b65c58e8e2
Related-Bug: #1582500

commit_message:
Remove rootwrap configuration from neutron-keepalived-state-change

New IP command introduced by Ie3fe825d65408fc969c478767b411fe0156e9fbc
requires only privsep initialization. This patch removes the prisep
error FailedToDropPrivileges when executed under neutron-rootwrap.

Closes-Bug: #1823038

Change-Id: I6cde3c9dae7ffdccce49e88c3c79d1c379f291cf
(cherry picked from commit aacd11ab9f8f24291f369d23662b0cb6b3fe43e3)

> "There is a Type and a Default, and the default value is "public" in there. So saying the default in the help is redundant"
Hi, http://logs.openstack.org/02/658102/8/check/openstack-tox-docs/dffcccd/html/configuration/watcher.html#keystone-client and http://logs.openstack.org/02/658102/9/check/openstack-tox-docs/bcbf73e/html/configuration/watcher.html#keystone_client.interface
are generated by these defination. If i remove these "redundant" option, these docs will not have these.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-05-17 08:40:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-05-17 19:54:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

> Hi, http://logs.openstack.org/02/658102/8/check/openstack-tox-docs/dffcccd/html/configuration/watcher.html#keystone-client and http://logs.openstack.org/02/658102/9/check/openstack-tox-docs/bcbf73e/html/configuration/watcher.html#keystone_client.interface are generated by these defination. If i remove these "redundant" option, these docs will not have these.

We must be talking past each other. :) I'm only saying you can remove the wording from the help text of the option. The supported values are auto-generated from the choices kwarg and the default (in the docs) is generated from the default kwarg.

To try and clarify, I pulled this changed down and made this change to the help text:

osboxes@osboxes:~/git/watcher$ git diff
diff --git a/watcher/conf/keystone_client.py b/watcher/conf/keystone_client.py
index 015731c6..e2ada386 100644
--- a/watcher/conf/keystone_client.py
+++ b/watcher/conf/keystone_client.py
@@ -23,9 +23,7 @@ KEYSTONE_CLIENT_OPTS = [
     cfg.StrOpt('interface',
                default='admin',
                choices=['internal', 'public', 'admin'],
-               help='Type of endpoint to use in keystoneclient. '
-                    'Supported values: internal, public, admin. '
-                    'The default is admin.'),
+               help='Type of endpoint to use in keystoneclient.'),
     cfg.StrOpt('region_name',
                help='Region in Identity service catalog to use for '
                     'communication with the OpenStack service.')]


Then I built the docs and this is what you get for the config option in the docs:


interface

    Type

        string
    Default

        admin
    Valid Values

        internal, public, admin

    Type of endpoint to use in keystoneclient.


So again, the "Default" is generated from the 'default' kwarg and the "Valid Values" are generated from the 'choices' kwarg, which means you don't need to repeat that information in the help kwarg, hence it being redundant.'}, {'account_id': 28748, 'date': '2019-05-18 07:48:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
support-keystoneclient-option

Some users may want to create keystoneclient by specifying the
type of endpoint and region name, so we need to supply the option
for user to choose.

Implements: blueprint support-keystoneclient-option

Change-Id: I49b33a69ec99d2a91568ce27ef89dc80b75e7091

[{'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-05-19 09:25:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-05-19 09:38:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-05-20 06:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from no_sockets_on_tests to improved_tests'}, {'account_id': 25314, 'date': '2019-05-20 06:37:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-05-20 10:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-05-25 05:53:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1

Working this as this is a low-impact patch. Following this up with another patch to re-add some of the test coverage.
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/661428/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-19 09:25:12.000000000', 'message': "Reduce the number of sockets needed for unit tests

Most of the time we don't actually need to bind to
tcp/udp sockets.

Change-Id: Ic6d2c7ab5283df1ad3953e86e65550f92dd0bc6b
"}, {'created': '2019-05-19 09:38:59.000000000', 'message': "Don't bind to tcp/udp when running unit-tests

Most of the time we don't actually need to bind to
tcp/udp sockets. We should only bind if we really
have to.

* Removed unit-tests used to test bindingg to actual ports.
* Don't bind to tcp/udp ports if we don't have to.
* Added check to make sure client was set before closing.

We should look at adding functional tests to catch
issues like described in bug 1566036.

Change-Id: Ic6d2c7ab5283df1ad3953e86e65550f92dd0bc6b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't bind to tcp/udp when running unit-tests

Most of the time we don't actually need to bind to
tcp/udp sockets. We should only bind if we really
have to.

* Removed unit-tests used to test bindingg to actual ports.
* Don't bind to tcp/udp ports if we don't have to.
* Added check to make sure client was set before closing.

We should look at adding functional tests to catch
issues like described in bug 1566036.

Change-Id: Ic6d2c7ab5283df1ad3953e86e65550f92dd0bc6b

[{'created': '2019-05-19 07:31:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix disk multiattach with VirtualBox 6

Starting with version 6.0, the behavior of VirtualBox with regards to
disk multiattach changed.

The new code should work for both VirtualBox 6 and older versions.

The workaround suggests that we may not be using the VirtualBox volumes
the way they are meant to be used, but with scant documentation out
there rewriting the volume logic may result in no improvement at all,
so let's leave it at that for the time being.

backport: rocky queens pike ocata

Change-Id: I9307d2e0f077539c118f540a9b0a4358e4f3b459
"}, {'created': '2019-05-19 07:36:56.000000000', 'message': "Fix disk multiattach with VirtualBox 6

Starting with version 6.0, the behavior of VirtualBox with regards to
disk multiattach changed.

The result are error messages like:
  VBoxManage: error: Cannot change type for medium '<base_disk_path>':
  the media type 'MultiAttach' can only be used on media registered
  with a machine that was created with VirtualBox 4.0 or later

The new code should work for both VirtualBox 6 and older versions.

The workaround suggests that we may not be using the VirtualBox volumes
the way they are meant to be used, but with scant documentation out
there rewriting the volume logic may result in no improvement at all,
so let's leave it at that for the time being.

backport: rocky queens pike ocata

commit_message:
Fix disk multiattach with VirtualBox 6

Starting with version 6.0, the behavior of VirtualBox with regards to
disk multiattach changed.

The result are error messages like:
  VBoxManage: error: Cannot change type for medium '<base_disk_path>':
  the media type 'MultiAttach' can only be used on media registered
  with a machine that was created with VirtualBox 4.0 or later

The new code should work for both VirtualBox 6 and older versions.

The workaround suggests that we may not be using the VirtualBox volumes
the way they are meant to be used, but with scant documentation out
there rewriting the volume logic may result in no improvement at all,
so let's leave it at that for the time being.

backport: rocky queens pike ocata

Closes-Bug: 1817584

Change-Id: I9307d2e0f077539c118f540a9b0a4358e4f3b459

commit_message:
Set arp_notify to match ndisc_notify

A previous change [1] enabled ndisc_notify, which is the IPv6 equivalent
for IPv4's arp_notify.  Enable the latter to keep them consistent with
each other.

Change-Id: I15e8348585a9c0ee824a4c123677992010980b9e
Related-Bug: #1827927

commit_message:
Add "project_name" variable to configure_functional_tests role

It will be useful when neutron-functional or neutron-fullstack
job will be used in stadium projects like e.g. in neutron-fwaas.

Change-Id: I73c446d43e44b8f06c93752ebf98684f165e6fcd
Related-Bug: #1804844

commit_message:
Drop the py35 testing, add the py37 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I0965666290c8e8f88d61d537ff58bbd1c63eeef6

commit_message:
Clean up zone locking

Updated the decorator to log something more appropriate when locking during
zone creation. The existing implementation would log 'zone-None', this
changes it to 'create-new-zone'.

We also add a try/finally catch statement to make sure the lock is always
released when done.

* Changed lock name to be more appropriate when creating new zones.
* Implement try/finally pattern to make sure lock is always released.

Change-Id: I0c7b45d3125ff1e007d44064a7653c1b2b07c770

commit_message:
Async notify neutron-server for HA states

RPC notifier method can sometimes be time-consuming,
this will cause other parallel processing resources
fail to send notifications in time. This patch changes
the notify to asynchronous.

Closes-Bug: #1824911
Change-Id: I3f555a0c78fbc02d8214f12b62c37d140bc71da1
(cherry picked from commit 0f471a47c073eb0cf2ed68c30482e1ae71ff6927)

commit_message:
fs027: test SSL with FQDN based undercloud_public_host

To provide a preventive action of bug 1763776, we want to test at least
one scenario where the undercloud_public_host is configured with the
FQDN and not the IP address.
This is the case of most of users deplying with SSL, when certificates
are generated based on the hostname/domain and not the IP.

Related-Bug #1763776
Depends-On: I6425499e5d248e6cb2285f14dd9c6e716122b90b
Change-Id: I1c222fce178e164432acbfaeda8695c3cf7a6e98

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 07:12:07.000000000', 'message': "NP: Delete default egress rules

When an SG is created, Neutron populates it with egress rules allowing
it to call anything. This isn't compliant with how network policies are
supposed to work in K8s. In order to correctly block all traffic we need
to remove those rules when creating the SG and this patch implements it.

Change-Id: I20860a52af843f770b6af5db65cfd9fb3e42ccfd
Closes-Bug: 1822174
(cherry picked from commit d29e150252e0bb1befe02f6241d9a1702450abc0)
"}]
commit_message:
NP: Delete default egress rules

When an SG is created, Neutron populates it with egress rules allowing
it to call anything. This isn't compliant with how network policies are
supposed to work in K8s. In order to correctly block all traffic we need
to remove those rules when creating the SG and this patch implements it.

Change-Id: I20860a52af843f770b6af5db65cfd9fb3e42ccfd
Closes-Bug: 1822174
(cherry picked from commit d29e150252e0bb1befe02f6241d9a1702450abc0)

commit_message:
Rehome tempest tests from networking-bgpvpn repo

This patch rehomes networking-bgpvpn tempest tests from
networking-bgpvpn repo to neutron_tempest_plugin.bgpvpn module.

It also adds definition of new, zuulv3 job which will run tests from
this neutron_tempest_plugin.bgpvpn module.

Change-Id: Ideb935b76c9a3b36f88a2a66dbfcb1844348cd86

In functional tests for L3 HA agent, like e.g.
L3HATestFailover.test_ha_router_failover

knob and test fails because it checks that only once just

commit_message:
Wait to ipv6 accept_ra be really changed by L3 agent

In functional tests for L3 HA agent, like e.g.
L3HATestFailover.test_ha_router_failover
it may happen that L3 agent will not change ipv6 accept_ra
knob and test fails because it checks that only once just
after router state is change.

This patch fixes that race by adding wait for 60 seconds to
ipv6 accept_ra change.

Change-Id: I459ce4b791c27b1e3d977e0de9fbdb21a8a379f5
Closes-Bug: #1829889

commit_message:
Improve doc of kolla-build '--docker-dir' option

Let's make clear that '--docker-dir' can be specified multiple times
as argument of kolla-build. It was not clear if '--docker-dir' options
accept comma separated list of values or it can be specified multiple
times.

Change-Id: I7cf9a7c2a6c7876e5784a3df93369e7fa5036173
Partial-Bug: #1827146
(cherry picked from commit da24177fd03e79ab0936aa3f63bd38ae55cc63c3)

commit_message:
Install ceph-mds in ceph-base on ubuntu/debian

Stable branch only

backport: pike

In the queens and earlier ceph images on ubuntu, ceph-mds is not
installed. At that point, ceph-mds was a separate package from ceph.
From the ceph release used in Rocky onwards, ceph-mds is packaged with
ceph.

Change-Id: If691820ea3dea3e8758819be42db60732680aad9
Closes-Bug: #1828774
(cherry picked from commit 8dd4c953fe996c47138706f7cf74c9f2e354d899)

subject: Fix multiple mon deployment failures
messages: [{'account_id': 24250, 'date': '2019-05-23 01:25:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 24072, 'date': '2019-05-24 20:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 01:25:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multiple mon deployment failures

When 4 or 5 mons are deployed, all mons will always be in the election
state, and the ceph cluster cannot be accessed.

After comparing with ceph-deploy, I found that when the cluster was
initialized, it did not use monmap. When adding a new mon node, it
needs to use monmap. According to the above situation, I fixed the
problem.

Change-Id: Idbfc6741d371adcb06ed97d578d75d3bce862743
Closes-bug: #1824783
(cherry picked from commit 285814353af29395932e15d78c6a154796978a21)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multiple mon deployment failures

When 4 or 5 mons are deployed, all mons will always be in the election
state, and the ceph cluster cannot be accessed.

After comparing with ceph-deploy, I found that when the cluster was
initialized, it did not use monmap. When adding a new mon node, it
needs to use monmap. According to the above situation, I fixed the
problem.

Change-Id: Idbfc6741d371adcb06ed97d578d75d3bce862743
Closes-bug: #1824783
(cherry picked from commit 285814353af29395932e15d78c6a154796978a21)

commit_message:
Fix where we use constraints

in I2598503c2d4397d7efbb03a76df9a4e91dd0c1cf we mistakenly added
constraints to install_command in out based testenv.  This is incorrect
as it means the generate env will be run in a constrained environment.

We don't use UPPER_CONSTRAINT_FILE as *right now* it's the same thing
and this leaves us internally consistent (even if technically incorrect)

Change-Id: Ia61d944dbfdf494598e41e5fbefd0e32a91814ed
(cherry picked from commit f43647b3edf8024669f378f1943278081ce9bd85)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-24 13:19:07.000000000', 'message': "Avoid tox failure on systems where python3 points to python3.4

Solves bug where linters environment was failing on CentOS 7 because
python3 pointed to unsupported py34, even when user may have already
intalled other newer python3 versions.

By changing the preference order of python interpreters in envlist, tox
will pick them and avoid using invalid version.

This means that running just 'tox' is like to run correctly on most
systems.

Change-Id: I20792de6e446b6908b08e88c29ae14852ffd58a4
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid tox failure on systems where python3 points to python3.4

Solves bug where linters environment was failing on CentOS 7 because
python3 pointed to unsupported py34, even when user may have already
intalled other newer python3 versions.

By changing the preference order of python interpreters in envlist, tox
will pick them and avoid using invalid version.

This means that running just 'tox' is like to run correctly on most
systems.

Change-Id: I20792de6e446b6908b08e88c29ae14852ffd58a4

commit_message:
Cap Bandit below 1.6.0, update sphinx requirement, uncap jsonschema

Bandit 1.6.0 accidentally changed how the exclusion list option is
handled and breaks our use of it. Since we generally cap linters
and only move them forward when we're ready to deal with the fallout,
cap Bandit to the previous version until we have a reason to move to
a newer version.

Sphinx 2.0 no longer works on python 2.7, so we need to start capping
it there as well.

The jsonschema cap was removed in g-r so we need to remove it here too.

Change-Id: Ie8f45e4130297b50a8e98031f3f01244e646bec7

commit_message:
Add mkhomedir option to ipa-client-install

To allow PAM to create home directory for
user who do not have one, ipa-client-install
need an option. This is added by MakeHomeDir
variable.

This commit includes a fix from ykarel to fix the
new variable type.

Related-bug: #1823727

Change-Id: I040014482e9126947b8c4a1d7b1bf7645f926c4b
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from commit 2471642f6f1423b11392856a38341095a7f52e06 and
 e3ad34aece1bf87bfd7367014699eee86ab6d5ca)

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/570202/3 : FAILURE in 2h 05m 41s'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2019-01-23 15:46:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Hi Matt! thanks for taking the time to check. let's say that a an instance is in cell0 and we try to rebuild it. There is the chance that the scheduling will fail and the conductor will try to bury it to cell0 again. If we soft delete the instance during rebuild, we would end up with a duplicate entry exception. I know that we could handle that exception, but I'm not sure what is the best approach here."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-01-24 23:03:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> There is the chance that the scheduling will fail and the conductor will try to bury it to cell0 again. If we soft delete the instance during rebuild, we would end up with a duplicate entry exception.

If we (soft) delete from cell0 during rebuild and then scheduling fails and we try to create in cell0 again, we should have a new id value (primary key) but I guess the duplicate entry exception would be on the uuid since there is a unique constraint on that field - is that what you see if you don't hard delete from cell0?

We could avoid the hard delete by simply handling the duplicate entry exception and just update the existing entry rather than try to create a new one (like you said). Probably need input from Dan Smith on this as well. I just don't really like the hard delete stuff since it's a weird one-off just for this flow."}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2019-01-28 09:20:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Handling the duplicate entry exception would be possible. To handle this, we would have to unset the deleted flag from all relevant soft deleted entries and reset the instance to ERROR state. The problem is that Tags and ConsoleAuthToken are (hard) deleted during instance soft delete (https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L1826). I am not sure how this should be handled.. I can upload a patch and figure it out.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2019-01-28 16:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 27057, 'date': '2019-01-28 16:55:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-23 13:54:58.000000000', 'message': 'Add instance hard delete

When rebuilding an instance that is mapped to cell0 we can end up in a
situation where the same instance is active and running in the cell
that is selected while scheduling and deleted in cell0.

The solution to this problem would be to hard delete the instance from
cell0 before starting the actual rebuilding procedure.

Change-Id: Ibf257276d879bfb409c00577607ae3b9712133fa
Implements: blueprint enable-rebuild-for-instances-in-cell0

commit_message:
Add instance hard delete

In order to avoid a situation where an instance is both in cell0
and rebuilt *out of* cell0, we need to first hard delete the instance
in cell0. This change adds the ability to hard delete an instance from
a cell DB.

Change-Id: Ibf257276d879bfb409c00577607ae3b9712133fa
Implements: blueprint enable-rebuild-for-instances-in-cell0

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 20:10:00.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IPA client when doing brownfield deployment of internal TLS

* Always use the FQDN supplied in the metadata.
* Read the metadata from network if hostname could not be determined.

These changes fix issues with deploying internal TLS after initialy
deploying without it (also known as a "brownfield deployment").

Change-Id: I9d1b4174dd349c29dc92079202176a11d3f85fe3
Co-Authored-By: Ade Lee <alee@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from commit 05f650d5da5f5e4b5d0e836a09e9cd7617be02a7)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix IPA client when doing brownfield deployment of internal TLS

* Always use the FQDN supplied in the metadata.
* Read the metadata from network if hostname could not be determined.

These changes fix issues with deploying internal TLS after initialy
deploying without it (also known as a "brownfield deployment").

Change-Id: I9d1b4174dd349c29dc92079202176a11d3f85fe3
Co-Authored-By: Ade Lee <alee@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from commit 05f650d5da5f5e4b5d0e836a09e9cd7617be02a7)

[{'created': '2019-05-24 10:14:50.000000000', 'message': "Install iputils package in neutron containers

This package provides e.g. arping tool which is used by Neutron
services.
On e.g. RHEL7 it was probably installed as some dependency to other
package but on RHEL8 it's missing which cause some errors e.g.
in neutron_l3_agent container.

Change-Id: I9c087164f32cb8a69d2155bc68b6f62233ad58c6
Related-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1713321
"}]
commit_message:
Install iputils package in neutron containers

This package provides e.g. arping tool which is used by Neutron
services.
On e.g. RHEL7 it was probably installed as some dependency to other
package but on RHEL8 it's missing which cause some errors e.g.
in neutron_l3_agent container.

Change-Id: I9c087164f32cb8a69d2155bc68b6f62233ad58c6
Related-Bug: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1713321

commit_message:
Remove python-jobs-trusty

We don't run master on trusty anymore, remove the template. The projects
already have a python-jobs template, so will keep jobs running, just now
on newer Ubuntu.

Change-Id: Ia3bc80873dd58e9d78d280c855fb7fe05a1d9154

Instead of taking a X-Backend-Allow-Method that *must match* the
REQUEST_METHOD, take a truish X-Backend-Allow-Private-Methods and
expand the set of allowed methods. This allows us to also expose

'}]
commit_message:
Rework private-request-method interface

Instead of taking a X-Backend-Allow-Method that *must match* the
REQUEST_METHOD, take a truish X-Backend-Allow-Private-Methods and
expand the set of allowed methods. This allows us to also expose
the full list of available private methods when returning a 405.

Drive-By: make async-delete tests a little more robust:
  * check that end_marker and prefix are preserved on subsequent
    listings
  * check that objects with a leading slash are correctly handled

Change-Id: I5542623f16e0b5a0d728a6706343809e50743f73

commit_message:
Fix sphinx requirements due to dropped 2.7 support

Sphinx 2.0.0 dropped support of python 2.7.
This fixes the requirements-check which is broken
due to https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657890/ .

Signed-off-by: Ilya Maximets <i.maximets@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Don't run functional.db tests in nova functional run

To further refine the tests being run during the nova functional
test job, remove the functional.db tests. These shouldn't be
interacting with placement and because some of them use live
mysql or postgresql services for the migration tests, are more
susceptible to intermittent failures when nodes are being slow.

Change-Id: I2cfc6cb74d3acf78043a20cc7254d1315d6fabf0

This is a good example of docs getting out of sync with code because they are effectively both code, but in different forms. I agree that the SQL comments sometimes help to understand what is being assembled but they are fragile to this kind of thing.

In that past I've wondered if our query generators should be methods of their own, with unit tests that evaluate the generated sql and then those tests would be the explainers.

That sounds like a lot of work we don't really have time for now, but maybe someday."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-05-24 13:51:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-24 14:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-05-24 14:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add functional confirm_migration_error test

This test checks if allocations have been
successfully cleaned up upon the driver failing
during "confirm_migration".

This backport is not clean due to change
If6aa37d9b6b48791e070799ab026c816fda4441c, which
refactored the testing framework. Within the refactor,
new assertion methods were added and method
"assertFlavorMatchesAllocation" was modified.
This backport needed to be adapted in order to
be compatible with the testing framework prior to
If6aa37d9b6b48791e070799ab026c816fda4441c.

Change-Id: I9d6478f492351b58aa87b8f56e907ee633d6d1c6
Related-bug: #1821594
(cherry picked from commit 873ac499c50125adc2fb49728d936922f9acf4a9)
(cherry picked from commit d7d7f115430c7ffeb88ec9dcd155ac69b29d7513)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-15 16:39:44.000000000', 'message': 'Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises (part 2)

The backport 37ac54a42ec91821d62864d63c486c002608491b to fix
bug 1821594 did not account for how the _delete_allocation_after_move
method before Stein is tightly coupled to the migration status
being set to "confirmed" which is what the _confirm_resize method
does after self.driver.confirm_migration returns.

However, if self.driver.confirm_migration raises an exception
we still want to cleanup the allocations held on the source node
and for that we call _delete_allocation_after_move. But because
of that tightly coupling before Stein, we need to temporarily
mutate the migration status to "confirmed" to get the cleanup
method to do what we want.

This isn't a problem starting in Stein because change
I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 removed that
tight coupling on the migration status, so this is a stable
branch only change.

Note that we don't call self.reportclient.delete_allocation_for_instance
directly since before Stein we still need to account for a
migration that does not move the source node allocations to the
migration record, and that logic is in _delete_allocation_after_move.

A simple unit test assertion is added here but the functional
test added in change I9d6478f492351b58aa87b8f56e907ee633d6d1c6
will assert the bug is fixed properly before Stein.

Change-Id: I933687891abef4878de09481937d576ce5899511
Closes-Bug: #1821594

commit_message:
[stable-only] Delete allocations even if _confirm_resize raises (part 2)

The backport 37ac54a42ec91821d62864d63c486c002608491b to fix
bug 1821594 did not account for how the _delete_allocation_after_move
method before Stein is tightly coupled to the migration status
being set to "confirmed" which is what the _confirm_resize method
does after self.driver.confirm_migration returns.

However, if self.driver.confirm_migration raises an exception
we still want to cleanup the allocations held on the source node
and for that we call _delete_allocation_after_move. But because
of that tight coupling before Stein, we need to temporarily
mutate the migration status to "confirmed" to get the cleanup
method to do what we want.

This isn't a problem starting in Stein because change
I0851e2d54a1fdc82fe3291fb7e286e790f121e92 removed that
tight coupling on the migration status, so this is a stable
branch only change.

Note that we don't call self.reportclient.delete_allocation_for_instance
directly since before Stein we still need to account for a
migration that does not move the source node allocations to the
migration record, and that logic is in _delete_allocation_after_move.

A simple unit test assertion is added here but the functional
test added in change I9d6478f492351b58aa87b8f56e907ee633d6d1c6
will assert the bug is fixed properly before Stein.

Change-Id: I933687891abef4878de09481937d576ce5899511
Closes-Bug: #1821594

commit_message:
Update uw_apache to run against bionic

uw_apache test was runned against xenial, which is not currrently
supported, due to which job was updated to run on bionic nodeset.

We also need to enable proxy_uwsgi for debian based distros.

Co-Authored-By: Guilherme Steinmuller Pimentel <gsteinmuller@vexxhost.com>
Co-Authored-By: Marc Gariépy <gariepy.marc@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibff3aa2a1ac1bbf2493aaf2419ee1e4dd763934c

commit_message:
functional: Mock _get_own_chassis_name

The metadata OVN test reloads chassis name when agent detects the
configuration is out of sync. This patch mocks the method for the whole
test to avoid exceptions in the log about unknown chassis - the mock
object.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: If6406ef38a33c0c8fc5ef249863b10578082bc1b

commit_message:
Add documentation about OVO "obj_make_compatible"

Adds new documentation about how to implement
"VersionedObject.obj_make_compatible" when a new object version
is released and how to test it.

Change-Id: I055cf2ae493759562175f9d859d2a065458ca7e2
Related-Bug: #1828437

commit_message:
Integrate rally with osprofiler

This patch adds integration of osprofiler with rally.
Rally provides possibility for such integration and when
osprofiler is configured in rally it will now place
osprofiler's report for each rally test iteration in
"Scenario Data" tab.

Change-Id: I730de963ef6fd0485be6ea947d085067057a500c

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-24 18:00:00.000000000', 'message': 'Remove placement HTTP configuration shipped with RPM package

The RDO placement RPM ships with an HTTP configuration deploying
placement on port 8778, while Kolla-Ansible configures it to listen on
port 8780. If `placement_api_port` is changed to use port 8778,
placement will fail to start because the port is already in use.

This commit removes the configuration file shipped with the RPM package
to avoid this conflict.

Change-Id: I7babdb794bec3b08047101e2537f030e2217cedb
'}]
commit_message:
Remove placement HTTP configuration shipped with RPM package

The RDO placement RPM ships with an HTTP configuration deploying
placement on port 8778, while Kolla-Ansible configures it to listen on
port 8780. If `placement_api_port` is changed to use port 8778,
placement will fail to start because the port is already in use.

This commit removes the configuration file shipped with the RPM package
to avoid this conflict.

Change-Id: I7babdb794bec3b08047101e2537f030e2217cedb

This begins to split the fluent-logging chart into two separate
charts, one for fluentbit and one for fluentd. This is to help
isolate each chart and its dependencies better, and to treat each
service as its own entity.

This also moves the job for creating Elasticsearch templates to
the Elasticsearch chart, as the elasticsearch chart should have
ownership of creating the templates for its indices.

This also performs some general cleanup of values keys that are
not currently used

commit_message:
Separate fluentbit and fluentd charts

This begins to split the fluent-logging chart into two separate
charts, one for fluentbit and one for fluentd. This is to help
isolate each chart and its dependencies better, and to treat each
service as its own entity.

This also moves the job for creating Elasticsearch templates to
the Elasticsearch chart, as the elasticsearch chart should have
ownership of creating the templates for its indices.

This also performs some general cleanup of values keys that are
not currently used

Change-Id: I827277d5faa62b8b59c5960330703d23c297ca47
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

subject: Fix where we use constraints
messages: [{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-24 00:27:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-24 00:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/ocata as commit fcd97cb83e64f55bc483649e1f05476b0ab26d89'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-05-24 00:28:11.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from u-c-stable/stein-stable/rocky-stable/queens-stable/pike to u-c'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2019-05-24 02:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-24 13:56:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-24 00:27:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix where we use constraints

in I2598503c2d4397d7efbb03a76df9a4e91dd0c1cf we mistakenly added
constraints to install_command in out based testenv.  This is incorrect
as it means the generate env will be run in a constrained environment.

We don't use UPPER_CONSTRAINT_FILE as *right now* it's the same thing
and this leaves us internally consistent (even if technically incorrect)

Change-Id: Ia61d944dbfdf494598e41e5fbefd0e32a91814ed
(cherry picked from commit f43647b3edf8024669f378f1943278081ce9bd85)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix where we use constraints

in I2598503c2d4397d7efbb03a76df9a4e91dd0c1cf we mistakenly added
constraints to install_command in out based testenv.  This is incorrect
as it means the generate env will be run in a constrained environment.

We don't use UPPER_CONSTRAINT_FILE as *right now* it's the same thing
and this leaves us internally consistent (even if technically incorrect)

Change-Id: Ia61d944dbfdf494598e41e5fbefd0e32a91814ed
(cherry picked from commit f43647b3edf8024669f378f1943278081ce9bd85)

commit_message:
Fix where we use constraints

in I2598503c2d4397d7efbb03a76df9a4e91dd0c1cf we mistakenly added
constraints to install_command in out based testenv.  This is incorrect
as it means the generate env will be run in a constrained environment.

We don't use UPPER_CONSTRAINT_FILE as *right now* it's the same thing
and this leaves us internally consistent (even if technically incorrect)

Change-Id: Ia61d944dbfdf494598e41e5fbefd0e32a91814ed
(cherry picked from commit f43647b3edf8024669f378f1943278081ce9bd85)

I'm kind of confused as to why --before 2018-11-07 didn't archive those records since the code is using <= logic rather than <, but I wasn't able to archive anything until I used 2018-11-08?'}, {'account_id': 8064, 'date': '2018-11-08 02:31:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Hi Matt, thanks for the review!

Re the last question, I think it is because when one is comparing against a DATETIME field and TIME wasn't provided, mysql fills that in with 00:00:00.

MariaDB [jake]> select * from temp;
+---------------------+
| deleted_at          |
+---------------------+
| 2018-11-07 19:39:29 |
| 2018-11-06 19:39:29 |
| 2018-11-08 19:39:29 |
+---------------------+
3 rows in set (0.00 sec)

MariaDB [jake]> select * from temp where deleted_at <= '2018-11-07';
+---------------------+
| deleted_at          |
+---------------------+
| 2018-11-06 19:39:29 |
+---------------------+
1 row in set (0.00 sec)

I will look through the other comments and work on them. Once again, thanks!"}, {'account_id': 8064, 'date': '2019-03-18 00:06:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 8064, 'date': '2019-03-18 00:08:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

commit_message:
Add --before to nova-manage db archive_deleted_rows

Add a parameter to limit the archival of deleted rows by date. That is,
only rows related to instances deleted before provided date will be
archived.

This option works together with --max_rows, if both are specified both
will take effect.

Closes-Bug: #1751192
Change-Id: I408c22d8eada0518ec5d685213f250e8e3dae76e
Implements: blueprint nova-archive-before

commit_message:
Update docs testing

Use doc/requirements for documentation requirements, this avoids pulling
in sphinx into the python environments and thus solves the problem that triggered
https://review.opendev.org/658224 as well.

Note that both changes are needed in general, while the problem is solved
with either.

Switch to openstackdocstheme instead of oslosphinx, update sphinx
requirements for this and sync with global requirements.

Change-Id: I360c185af8740a71ebc0f5f49debd5b6032161ec

commit_message:
Add mkhomedir option to ipa-client-install

To allow PAM to create home directory for
user who do not have one, ipa-client-install
need an option. This is added by MakeHomeDir
variable.

This commit includes a fix from ykarel to fix the
new variable type.

Related-bug: #1823727

Change-Id: I040014482e9126947b8c4a1d7b1bf7645f926c4b
Signed-off-by: Cyril Lopez <cylopez@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from commit 2471642f6f1423b11392856a38341095a7f52e06 and
 e3ad34aece1bf87bfd7367014699eee86ab6d5ca)

commit_message:
inet6 prefix utility

Utility to handle prefixing IPv6 address with `inet6:`.

This is useful for services relying on python-memcached
which require the inet6:[<ip_address]:<port> format.

Change-Id: Ibd280929f62bae61f34b2984af7710fbd422264b

[{'created': '2019-05-23 10:45:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Octavia certificate file path and content

Certificate files were being created in a wrong path and with invalid
content. The bug was caused because Ansible variables were not being
quoted, and as so Ansible assumed plain text instead.

Closes-Bug: #1830190

Change-Id: Ie576537d77b57927d430f20b274d1cb5d351241e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Octavia certificate file path and content

Certificate files were being created in a wrong path and with invalid
content. The bug was caused because Ansible variables were not being
quoted, and as so Ansible assumed plain text instead.

Closes-Bug: #1830190

Change-Id: Ie576537d77b57927d430f20b274d1cb5d351241e

commit_message:
Update master for stable/stein

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/stein.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/stein.

Change-Id: I60f4a2e16c6fe35a26c1c5a3226b6c18cb5ef800

commit_message:
Add spec for indicator management

This spec proposes to add hardware indicator (e.g. LED) list/get/set
feature.

Change-Id: I43c8dbf485bd54a3617c9193580279a7ffd65fd2
Story: 2005342

subject: Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-23 23:51:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I096836a7bc9bf6f04429a5c886312f2ec907d1bf
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I096836a7bc9bf6f04429a5c886312f2ec907d1bf

[{'created': '2019-05-23 20:03:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix IPA client when doing brownfield deployment of internal TLS

* Always use the FQDN supplied in the metadata.
* Read the metadata from network if hostname could not be determined.

These changes fix issues with deploying internal TLS after initialy
deploying without it (also known as a "brownfield deployment").

Related-Bug: 1830235
Change-Id: I9d1b4174dd349c29dc92079202176a11d3f85fe3
